text: Chikila fulleri, the Kuttal caecilian or Fuller's caecilian, is a species of caecilian endemic to India; the type specimen was collected six miles southwest of Silchar in Cachar, Assam, at an altitude of about 100 m above sea level.http://eol.org/pages/1019464/overview In 2012 it was reassigned to a newly erected family, Chikilidae. It is known only from northeast India (Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, and Tripura), although it is expected to be found also in nearby Bangladesh and Myanmar. ==References== Category:Chikilidae Category:Amphibians of India Category:Endemic fauna of India Category:Amphibians described in 1904
title: Chikila fulleri
